metadata.Title: CVE-2021-22555 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
A heap out-of-bounds write affecting Linux since v2.6.19-rc1 was discoveredin net/netfilter/x_tables.c. This allows an attacker to gain privileges orcause a DoS (via heap memory corruption) through user name space

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-22555` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-187-generic - 3.13.0-187.238
linux-image-3.13.0-187-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-187.238
linux-image-3.13.0-187-lowlatency - 3.13.0-187.238
linux-image-3.13.0-187-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-187.238
linux-image-3.13.0-187-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-187.238
linux-image-3.13.0-187-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-187.238
linux-image-3.13.0-187-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-187.238
linux-image-3.13.0-187-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-187.238
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-187-generic - 3.13.0-187.238
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-187-lowlatency - 3.13.0-187.238
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-213-generic - 4.4.0-213.245~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-213-generic - 4.4.0-213.245~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-213-lowlatency - 4.4.0-213.245~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1095-aws - 4.4.0-1095.100
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-azure - 4.15.0-1115.128~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-187.238').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-213.245~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1095.100').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.128~14.04.1').
